encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Submit - Deleted a wrong link to the image and inserted a correct one

Finalized - Ready. Updated text and metadata to reflect Kotyl (2019). Only a few points of commentary have been included, despite my earlier vote, on the grounds that the readings on the papyrus are attested in other mss.

Finalized - Ready. Updated text and metadata to reflect Kotyl (2019). Only a few points of commentary have been included, despite my earlier vote, on the grounds that the readings on the papyrus are attested in other mss.

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - Implement M. Sampson's requests, i.e. in i.5 change scribal accent to grave; in i.6 instead of angled brackets, make the iota subscript (and remove line break); i.10 insert *middot* after φιλοι; i.11 dot upsilon in [θ]υμῶι; remove lost.22lin from end of col.i (as some of these 22 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column); remove lost.19lin from end of col.ii (as some of these 19 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column); remove lost.29lin from end of col.iii (as some of these 29 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column)—codicological commentary can clarify; at iii.1 the ed.pr. has .4[.?]; reading variants should be incorporated for 7.186, 7.187, 7.188, 7.195-99, 7.221. METADATA: delete volume number entry from 95225; correct the MP3 number (= 805.0); the inventory number according to the ed.pr. is Bridwell papyrus 5 (TM metadata is a bit confusing here).

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - Implement M. Sampson's requests, i.e. in i.5 change scribal accent to grave; in i.6 instead of angled brackets, make the iota subscript (and remove line break); i.10 insert *middot* after φιλοι; i.11 dot upsilon in [θ]υμῶι; remove lost.22lin from end of col.i (as some of these 22 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column); remove lost.19lin from end of col.ii (as some of these 19 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column); remove lost.29lin from end of col.iii (as some of these 29 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column)—codicological commentary can clarify; at iii.1 the ed.pr. has .4[.?]; reading variants should be incorporated for 7.186, 7.187, 7.188, 7.195-99, 7.221. METADATA: delete volume number entry from 95225; correct the MP3 number (= 805.0); the inventory number according to the ed.pr. is Bridwell papyrus 5 (TM metadata is a bit confusing here).

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - Text: placing scribal *apostrophe* after an apostrophe produces a double apostrophe in the app.crit (can this be avoided?); in i.5 change scribal accent to grave; in i.6 instead of angled brackets, make the iota subscript (and remove line break); i.10 insert *middot* after φιλοι; i.11 dot upsilon in [θ]υμῶι; remove lost.22lin from end of col.i (as some of these 22 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column); remove lost.19lin from end of col.ii (as some of these 19 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column); remove lost.29lin from end of col.iii (as some of these 29 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column)—codicological commentary can clarify; at iii.1 the ed.pr. has .4[.?]; various bits of commentary should be incorporated (i.e., 7.186, 7.187, 7.188, 7.195-99, 7.221. METADATA: delete volume number entry from 95225; correct the MP3 number (= 805.0); should pagination be updated under physical description?; the inventory number according to the ed.pr. is Bridwell papyrus 5 (TM metadata is a bit confusing here).

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - Text: placing scribal *apostrophe* after an apostrophe produces a double apostrophe in the app.crit (can this be avoided?); in i.5 change scribal accent to grave; in i.6 instead of angled brackets, make the iota subscript (and remove line break); i.10 insert *middot* after φιλοι; i.11 dot upsilon in [θ]υμῶι; remove lost.22lin from end of col.i (as some of these 22 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column); remove lost.19lin from end of col.ii (as some of these 19 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column); remove lost.29lin from end of col.iii (as some of these 29 lines could have been at the head of the next page’s column)—codicological commentary can clarify; at iii.1 the ed.pr. has .4[.?]; various bits of commentary should be incorporated (i.e., 7.186, 7.187, 7.188, 7.195-99, 7.221.
